com.marklogic.semantics.jena.client

Class JenaDatabaseClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.marklogic.semantics.jena.client.JenaDatabaseClient

  • public class JenaDatabaseClient
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to encapsulate access to the Java API's DatabaseClient for Jena users. Access the underlying Java API client with getClient(); The DatabaseClient is a long-lived object. You should expect to reuse a single client for all connections that share state (username, password, etc.)

      • close

        public void close()
        Close the connection and free resources

      • setTimerCacheInterval

        public void setTimerCacheInterval(long millis)
        Set the interval at which the write and delete cache flush to MarkLogic. Provided for internal diagnostic tuning.
        Parameters:
        millis - The interval, in milliseconds at which the local write and delete buffers are to be flushed.

      • getTimerCacheInterval

        public long getTimerCacheInterval()
        Get the current interval for sending write and delete requests to the server.
        Returns:
        The current setting for writing and deleting triples, in milliseconds.

      • newQueryDefinition

        public com.marklogic.client.semantics.SPARQLQueryDefinition newQueryDefinition(java.lang.String queryString)
        Create a new SPARQLQueryDefinition from a query String. You can use the resulting object to configure various aspects of the query or set binding variables.
        Parameters:
        queryString - A SPARQL Query or SPARQL Update.
        Returns:
        A new SPARQLQueryDefinition

        public void sinkQuad(org.apache.jena.graph.Node g,
                     org.apache.jena.graph.Node s,
                     org.apache.jena.graph.Node p,
                     org.apache.jena.graph.Node o)

        g - Graph node.
        s - Subject node
        p - Property node.
        o - Object Node.
